column1: 10AEFB95-1DB8-4A51-8EA9-91FE5733C56E#appfire#04A03FE5-090B-4CE3-9C6B-523D2EA26007#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-10 07:17:59.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-10 07:17:59.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#4C29C6B8-C1C6-4B1E-A970-AA3FF8543BCF#appfire#04A03FE5-090B-4CE3-9C6B-523D2EA26007#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-10 07:17:59.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-10 07:17:59.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#8452D564-2FCA-4B39-A283-1F3AEE1B1CB0#appfire#04A03FE5-090B-4CE3-9C6B-523D2EA26007#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-10 07:17:59.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-10 07:17:59.0#appfire#1
